intro: Malapoenna cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved malapoenna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in grasslands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Malapoenna cuneata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
